circumstances: En route from Sebring to Miami, smoke spread in the cabin and the pilot decided to reduce his altitude and to attempt an emergency landing. On final, the twin engine airplane collided with rocks, lost its right main gear and crashed. Both occupants were injured.
probable_cause:
Collision with object during landing roll after smoke in cockpit. The following contributing factors were reported:
- Fire in cabin, cockpit, baggage compartment, 
- Wt, soft ground, 
- Rough terrain,
- Forced landing off airport on land, 
- Smoke in cockpit,
- Collided with rocks, 
- Right gear sheared off, 
- Fire in cockpit from undetermined origin.
